Aggregate data to YEAR and borrow length samples from other years

Source: R/aggregate_to_year.R
aggregate_to_year.Rd

If the number of length samples are too sparse at NEGEAR/MARKET_CODE level to retain at QTR year then landings are aggregated to YEAR level. YEARs with missing length samples are filled with length sample data from the closest YEAR

aggregate_to_year(
  data,
  gearType,
  mainGearType,
  marketCode,
  aggYEARData,
  sampleStartYear,
  missingEarlyYears,
  proportionMissing,
  nLengthSamples,
  pValue,
  outputDir,
  logfile
)

Arguments

data

List. Landings data and length data
gearType

Character string. NEGEAR gear code
mainGearType

Character string. Name of NEGEAR with most landings
marketCode

Character string. MARKET_CODE designation from cfdbs
sampleStartYear

Numeric scalar. Year first length sample was taken
missingEarlyYears

Numeric vector. Years prior to first length sample was taken
proportionMissing

numeric scalar. Proportion of missing samples allowed per YEAR for each MARKET_CODE/GEAR combination). Passed from aggregate_landings
pValue

Numeric scalar. Threshold pvalue for determining significance of ks test for length samples
outputDir

Character string. Path to output directory (png files saved here)
aggYearData

Tibble. (n x 3). YEAR, total landings, presence/absence of min mumber of samples
nLenthSamples

Numeric scalar. Number of length samples deemed to be "enough" for calculations. This is passed from aggregate_landings
logFile

Character string. Specify the name for the log file generated describing all decisions made.

Value

List. Same as input data

Contents

Developed by Andy Beet, Laurel Smith, Sean Lucey.
